name: Xi Wangmu
title: Chinese - Xi Wangmu
shortDescription: Ë•øÁéãÊØç (Xi Wang Mu) - Queen Mother of the West
longDescription:
Queen Mother of the West (Ë•øÁéãÊØç), Golden Mother of the Jade Pool (Áë∂Ê±†ÈáëÊØç), Lady Queen Mother (ÁéãÊØçÂ®òÂ®ò), Primordial Ruler of the Western Heaven

Immortality, longevity, feminine power, the West, paradise, cosmic yin, female immortals, death and rebirth

Peaches of immortality (Ëü†Ê°É), jade palace, phoenix, three-legged crow, nine-tailed fox, cinnabar

Peaches of Immortality, Elixir of Life, jade hairpin (sheng), magical peach wood staff

Phoenix (female), three-legged crow (messengers), blue birds, nine-tailed fox, white tiger

Royal purple (royalty), peach pink (immortality), jade green (paradise), gold (divinity)

Xi Wangmu's most famous treasure is her garden of immortal peaches, which grow on Mount Kunlun:

Every eon, Xi Wangmu hosts the Peach Banquet (Ëü†Ê°É‰ºö), inviting all gods and immortals to feast on the ripened peaches. This is the most prestigious event in the celestial calendar. In Journey to the West, Sun Wukong's theft of these peaches and disruption of the banquet was one of his greatest offenses against heaven.

Xi Wangmu's realm is the legendary Mount Kunlun (ÊòÜ‰ªëÂ±±), described as the axis mundi connecting earth and heaven:

Mount Kunlun represents the ultimate paradise - a realm of perfect beauty, eternal youth, and divine power. Those who reach it join the ranks of the immortals.

Xi Wangmu is one of the oldest deities in Chinese religion, appearing in texts from the Shang dynasty oracle bones through to contemporary worship. Her mythology evolved dramatically over millennia, from a fearsome goddess of plague and punishment to the benevolent Queen of Immortality.

Xi Wangmu represents fundamental cosmic principles in Chinese philosophy:

relatedConcepts.name: üçë GREAT GODDESS / DIVINE QUEEN
relatedConcepts.description: Xi Wangmu embodies the Great Goddess archetype - primordial feminine power, keeper of life and death, guardian of immortality, dwelling in the sacred mountain paradise.
